Package com.graphql_java_generator.client.directive

Class Directive

java.lang.Object
com.graphql_java_generator.client.directive.Directive
public class Directive
extends Object
This object can represent both:
  • A directive definition, as defined in the GraphQL schema, or as a standard GraphQL directive (skip, include, deprecated). In this case the argument's value is null.
  • An applied directive within a query/mutation/subscription. In this case, the argument's value is the value read in the query/mutation/subscription. Thus it can be a hard coded value, or a bind parameter)/
Author:
etienne-sf

  • Constructor Details

    • Directive

      public Directive​(QueryTokenizer qt, String schema) throws GraphQLRequestPreparationException
      Create a Directive from a QueryTokenizer. This QueryTokenizer should have read the starting @, and the next token should be the directive's name.
      Parameters:
      qt -
      schema - value of the springBeanSuffix plugin parameter for the searched schema. When there is only one schema, this plugin parameter is usually not set. In this case, its default value ("") is used.
      Throws:
      GraphQLRequestPreparationException

    • Directive

      public Directive()
      Default constructor, used by the generated DirectiveRegistryInitialize
      Parameters:
      qt -

      public void appendToGraphQLRequests​(StringBuilder sb, Map<String,​Object> parameters) throws GraphQLRequestExecutionException
      Appends this current directive into the given StringBuilder, to build the GraphQL request
      Parameters:
      sb -
      parameters - The list of bind values for the possible bind parameters
      Throws:
      GraphQLRequestExecutionException
